executiveSummary: Q4 2024 was a strong quarter for the Platform team, with all major OKRs achieved and system reliability exceeding targets. We successfully launched the new authentication service, migrated 85% of services to Kubernetes, and reduced infrastructure costs by 23%. Key challenges included unexpected growth in API traffic (addressed through auto-scaling improvements) and two significant incidents that informed our reliability roadmap for Q1 2025.

sections.title: Objectives and Key Results
sections.content: The Platform team set four primary objectives for Q4 2024. This section reviews our progress and outcomes.

subsections.title: Objective 1: Launch Authentication Service v2
subsections.content:
**Status: Achieved (100%)**

The new authentication service was launched on November 15, 2024, with zero customer-facing issues. Key results:
- Passwordless authentication adoption: 34% (target: 25%)
- Authentication latency p99: 45ms (target: <100ms)
- MFA enrollment rate: 67% (target: 50%)

subsections.title: Objective 2: Kubernetes Migration
subsections.content:
**Status: Partially Achieved (85%)**

Migration of legacy services to Kubernetes proceeded well but fell short of the 100% target due to complexity with the billing service.
- Services migrated: 34/40 (85%)
- Zero downtime migrations: 34/34 (100%)
- Remaining services scheduled for Q1 2025

subsections.title: Objective 3: Infrastructure Cost Reduction
subsections.content:
**Status: Exceeded (115%)**

Cost optimization initiatives delivered savings of $287K against a target of $250K.
- Reserved instance optimization: $142K saved
- Right-sizing analysis: $89K saved
- Spot instance adoption: $56K saved

subsections.title: Objective 4: Developer Experience Improvements
subsections.content:
**Status: Achieved (100%)**

- CI/CD pipeline time: 8.2 min (target: <10 min)
- Developer satisfaction score: 4.2/5 (target: 4.0/5)
- Self-service provisioning adoption: 78% (target: 70%)

sections.title: System Reliability
sections.content: Overall system reliability exceeded targets for the quarter, with 99.97% availability against a 99.9% SLA.

sections.title: Incident Analysis
sections.content: Two significant incidents occurred during Q4, both resulting in process improvements.

tables.title: Incident Summary - Q4 2024
tables.notes: All incidents had post-mortems completed within 48 hours. Action items tracked in Jira.

findings.content: Kubernetes migration is delivering measurable improvements in deployment velocity and resource utilization
New authentication service has 34% passwordless adoption, exceeding the 25% target
Certificate management process gap led to preventable SEV-2 incident
API traffic growth (40% YoY) requires capacity planning review

recommendations.content: Implement automated certificate rotation for all production services
Complete remaining Kubernetes migrations (billing, legacy reporting)
Conduct capacity planning review for 2x traffic growth scenario

risks.description: Billing service migration complexity may cause delays
risks.mitigation: Dedicated engineer assigned, extended timeline with buffer

risks.description: Vendor price increases for cloud services
